page.title: 06CHILDREN IN WADDINGTON
page.content: Although Waddington is surrounded by countryside it is nearly all farmland and there is nowhere in the countryside that children can play. In upper Waddington there is a small playground with swings, a slide and a "witch's hat" and in lower Waddington there is a small playground in the corner of a sports field but these are usually broken. Apart from these there are only the public playing fields where children can play safely. A group of typical 10 and 11 year- old children spend their spare time riding bikes or roller skating in the streets, playing football, collecting coins or writing stories. They attend guides, netball, tennis, swimming clubs and play at the Astro Club but most of them think the youth clubs in both upper and lower Waddington mainly cater for the older children.
